title: Martin Luther King, Jr., Federal Holiday, 2026
summary: Proclamation 11004 of January 19, 2026, designates January 19, 2026, as the Martin Luther King, Jr., Federal Holiday. The proclamation honors Dr. King's legacy and his commitment to justice, liberty, and equal rights, emphasizing his iconic "content of their character" speech. It reaffirms the nation's dedication to the principles Dr. King defended and encourages Americans to engage in acts of service to honor his dream. The proclamation also mentions the declassification of documents related to his assassination as a step towards revealing the truth.
